response.original_title: The Clydach Murders: Beyond Reasonable Doubt
response.overview: It was a brutal mass murder which shocked a close-knit Welsh community to the core. Three generations of one family were beaten to death in their home in Clydach, near Swansea, in June 1999, leading to South Wales Policeâ€™s largest ever murder hunt. BBC Wales Investigates reveals new evidence and questions the safety of the conviction of David Morris.
response.title: The Clydach Murders: Beyond Reasonable Doubt
